page.title: 01LAMPLUGH GREEN.
page.content: Most of the village of Lamplugh lies outside the hamlet of Lamplugh Green and as such is outside this Domesday block. The vilage is widely scattered lacking a residential centre in the traditional sense. The reports in this section seek to give an impression on some of the activities which shape and influence the lives of those living in the area. Many committees and organisations have the name Lamplugh but lack a base which ties them to a specific place, these are included in this section. The Lake District National Park covers much of the area which is both open and fenced fell land. This is used for grazing by the farms: Smaithwaite, Cockan, Cockley Gill, Lamplugh Hall and Scalesmoor There are many footpaths and these are used by walkers. The area is used extensively for recreation.
